column4: So whenever I need to type multiple words into the terminal, I need to include "\ "? So "My\ Documents"?
How do I install a .bin file after chmodding it to a+x?
if its a directory, yes
usually i think its ./nameoffile... but i could be wrong
what are you trying to install from a bin file?
I still don't get the point of including "./" at the beginning.
don't ask me, thas just what they want you to do.
So whenever executing a file, "./" must be inserted?
where do you have this my documents flder.. i'm guessing you're not putting in the right path
I'm already inside a dir under the "My Documents" dir.
I get that error msg when running the .bin file.
ok, wha tare you trying to install from the bin file?
isn't realplayer in the repos?
try  sudo apt-get install realplay
user malfunction i suspect.
yes, user malfunction....
I did everything correct.
then it should have installed, spaces be damned
on eof these days people will learn, upgrades always suck, do clean installs, and you'll have no headaches
Maybe I should just install Gentoo.
lmao, yeah.. there's a problem-free distro..lol
